trial_identification.studytitle: A randomised trial of two types of orthoses for exertional medial shin pain
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparison of effects of prefabricated and customised orthoses on pain and function in people with medial exertional shin pain

interventions.interventions: The trial compares two active interventions. The prefabricated orthoses will be a three-quarter length Vasyli device made from a firm high density EVA (ethyl vinyl acetate) which will be heat moulded to the participant's neutral foot position. Both will be worn for gradually increasing periods for day, eventually all day, for the three month trial period.
interventions.comparator: The customised orthoses will be a Modified Root Device fabricated from a neutral suspension cast using 4mm polypropylene (thermoplastic) with a vinyl cover. It will be worn for gradually increasing periods for day, eventually all day, for the three month trial period.

primaryOutcome.outcome: 2. patient-specific measure of function (average of three ratings on a visual analogue scales)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Participants will be military personnel presenting to military medical clinics. Seeking treatment for the first time for pain or tenderness along the medial border of the leg that i) is induced by exercise, ii) persists after exercise, and iii) limits participation in routine daily physical activities; symptoms have persisted for at least one month.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Symptoms have persisted for more than six months.

trial_design.concealment: Each participant will be randomly assigned to one of two groups by drawing the next of a series of opaque, consecutively numbered envelopes. The randomisation schedule and envelopes will be prepared by another of the investigators who will not be involved in the recruitment process, so allocation will be concealed.
trial_design.sequence: The allocation schedule will be blocked but will be otherwise unrestricted. The sequence will be generated by computer.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: School of Biomedical and Health Sciences University of Western Sydney Campbelltown Campus Locked Bag 1797 Penrith South DC 1797

fundingsource.fundingaddress: School of Biomedical and Health Sciences University of Western Sydney Campbelltown Campus Locked Bag 1797 Penrith South DC 1797

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This randomised trial will compare the effectiveness of two types of orthoses - a customised orthosis and a prefabricated orthosis - in management of medial exertional shin pain.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Holsworthy Army Barracks- Australian Defence Human Research Ethics Committee
Holsworthy Army Barracks-Human Research Ethics Committee of the University of Sydney
